noun.description: A reason for doing something, especially one that is hidden or not obvious.
(in art, literature, or music) a motif.
examples: the entire work grows organically from the opening horn motive
the charge of gas is the motive force for every piston stroke

adjective.description: Causing or being the reason for something.
examples: the motive principle of a writer's work

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French motif (adjective used as a noun), from late Latin motivus, from movere to move.
